channel.title: Info, Schedule & Co on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Info, Schedule & Co on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme

item.title: Main Teaching Reference
item.description: Main Teaching Reference While this course does not come with a list of mandatory readings, we will often refer to some central resources in R and python, which for the most part can always be accessed in a free and updated online version. We generally recommed you to use these amazing ressources for problem-solfing and further self-study on the topic. R Wickham, H., & Grolemund, G. (2016). R for data science: import, tidy, transform, visualize, and model data.

item.title: Modules
item.description: Modules The course is structured in 3 modules. M1: Applied Data Science and Machine Learning This module will prove a condensed introduction to the “Data Science Pipeline”, introducing students to methods, techniques, and workflows in applied data analytics and machine learning, including data acquisition, preparation, analysis, visualization, and communication. M2: Network Analysis and Natural Language Processing Focuses on analyzing a variety of unstructured data sources. Particularly, students will learn how to explore, analyze, and visualize natural language (text) as well as relational (network) data.

item.title: Semester Schedule
item.description: Schedule and Calendar: M1: Week 35-39 Topics W 35: Introduction & landing W 36: Data Manipulation, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA), Data Visualization W 37: Unsupervised Machine Learning (UML) W 38: Supervised Machine Learning (SML) W 39: Project work + exam Key Dates Individual assignment 1: 08.-13.09.2021, 23:59:00 at the latest (Peergrade) 2: 15.-20.09.2021, 23:59:00 at the latest (Peergrade) Group assignment: 21.-27.09.2021 (Digital Eksamen) Final exam: 29.
